result.execSummary:
The defendant Joey A. Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH. Huber for employment or counseling.  Court will allow ELM.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joey A. Willis

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Phil Marry.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  825 -   Victim rights compliance  .Chapter 85 completed. DE enters plea of guilty as to Ct1 - found guilty by the court. PSI waived by all parties. Sentence recommendations made.  Defendant is sentenced to 6 months in the Kenosha County Jail w/ huber for employment or counseling.  Credit for 3 days. Court will allow ELM. No claim for restitution made. Court orders a $2400 fine plus costs, due in 30 days from date of release or civil judgment. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  DL revoked for 36 months. Ignition interlock ordered. Intox assessment ordered. Appeal rights given. Certified copy of minutes given to deputy.

Court grants adjournment - DE must have confirmation of program enrollment or information on alternatives. BWAR is vacated.  Status scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Per Atty Marry - VA scheduled 3/14/16 @ 2pm. Parties notified by email.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. James Allen for Atty. Phil Marry. Clerk LE.   Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 8-5-15 @ 1:30pm. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

1:57  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matt Perz. Clerk LE.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  5-22-15 @ 9:30 am.   $2500.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.
